title: Is it okay to write your college essay about mental health or emotional struggles? - Quora

response.answer_text: In theory, you are free to write on any topic(s) you desire. Think however about this exercise from a strategic point of view. That means placing yourself in the position of the person reading your personal story. Is the story engaging? Is this someone you want at the school? You see my point. Try to keep your story as positive as possible. After all what you can contribute to the incoming class is a major determinant in getting accepted. For further counsel, contact me directly.

You may write about whatever you choose, but I would advise against any topic which might cause an admissions officer to be reluctant to admit you. This would, in my opinion, cause concerns. It is also a difficult subject to deal with in an essay, and a high school student is unlikely to have sufficient skills for the task.

There are risks that may be difficult to avoid. Because it’s such an emotional topic, one misuse of a term could make you appear intolerant or insensitive. Writing solely about yourself might make you appear far more self-centered than you are in a brief encounter like an essay. Of course, get it just right and you will look like a rhetorical superhero. Are you up to it?

I would be cautious, and I suggest if it is impirtant to you to do so, you clearly identify your goals, have a teacher, counsrlor, or other accomplished writer serve as an editor, and carefully maintain a positive optimism, making clear the ways your struggles have strengthen you and made you a better candidate.
Yes, in cases where you helped others with THEIRS. Never mention anything like that about yourself. Show cars only from the good deck.
